isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PACE - 1992 - 1993 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION - SENSOR INPUT TO PT PACER UNIT

svcproc.title: SENSOR INPUT TO PT PACER UNIT
svcproc.para: The PT Pacer Control Unit receives an AC (alternating current) signal from the vehicle speed sensor and the engine speed sensor.

Both sensors have two leads and are dual coil sensors. Even though the resistance of the two coils in each sensor is different, the leads are interchangeable. The resistance of one coil is between 900-1100 ohms and the other coil is between 1200-1450 ohms.

Vehicle Speed Sensor -The vehicle speed sensor is located at the rear of the transmission. The sensor is a permanent magnetic and as the speedometer gear rotates, the magnetic field is broken, creating the AC voltage. One lead connects to the PT Pacer Control Unit harness and the other lead connects to the engine harness speedometer circuits.

Engine Speed Sensor - The engine speed sensor (installed by Cummins) is located in the engine flywheel housing and the sensor magnetic field is broken by the flywheel teeth as it rotates. One lead connects to the PT Pacer Control Unit harness and the other connects to the engine harness tachometer circuits.
